app.connection_help.computer_device: The micro:bit device should show up in your file browser.
app.connection_help.connect_microbit: Use a USB cable to connect the micro:bit to your computer.
app.connection_help.connecting:
With your Rover powered on and displaying the R, push the connect
                button below.
app.connection_help.done: Then, choose the BBC micro:bit device from the list and click Pair.
app.connection_help.firmware_complete:
After a few seconds of a blinking light, you should see an R
                displayed on the micro:bit's display.
app.connection_help.firmware_expansion_p:
If your micro:bit doesn't display an R, you need to download
                      and flash the Rovercode firmware. Click here to see how.
app.connection_help.firmware_flash_link: More instructions can be found here.
app.connection_help.firmware_hex_button: Click here to download the firmware hex file
app.connection_help.firmware_need:
Plug the micro:bit into Gigglebot, and turn on
                the power switch (on the front passenger side).
app.connection_help.firmware_save:
Click the button below to download the firmware hex file,
                and choose to save it directly to the micro:bit device.
app.connection_help.gigglebot_link: If you don't already have a Gigglebot, click here to order one
app.connection_help.gigglebot_ordering:
The Rover is your robot. Rovercode works with the Gigglebot,
                which is a robot chassis with a micro:bit computer.
app.connection_help.show: Show this guide each time I log in
app.connection_help.to_courses: Congrats, you're connected! Click here, and let's write some code.
app.course_list.nothing: Sorry, no courses match your filters.
app.course_list.title: Courses
app.global.not_exist: Sorry, the page you're looking for doesn't exist.
app.lesson_card.blocked2: your account to access this lesson.
app.login.account_question: Already have a Rovercode account? Sign in here:
app.login.button_github: Sign up or sign in with GitHub
app.login.button_google: Sign up or sign in with Google
app.login.login: Welcome! To use Rovercode, you need an account for saving and sharing your work.
app.login.social_callback_error: There was an error creating an account using social provider.
app.login.social_error: There was an error initiating social login.
app.login.social_question: Don't have any of those accounts?
app.mission_control.read_only_content: Remix it to make your own copy.
app.password_reset.email: Enter your e-mail address below, and well send you an e-mail allowing you to reset it.
app.password_reset_callback.new_password: Enter a new password for your account below.
app.plan_class.code1: If you have a class code, enter
app.plan_class.code2: it below to join your class plan.
app.plan_class.contact1: Contact us to setup a class plan
app.problem_reporter.attempt: What were you working on doing?
app.problem_reporter.attempt_placeholder: I was trying to write code that...
app.problem_reporter.expectation: What did you expect to happen?
app.problem_reporter.tell_us: Tell us about it, and we can try to fix it.
app.problem_reporter.thank_you:
Thank you so much for reporting this issue.
                We will contact you via the email address on your Rovercode account with our resolution.
                In the meantime, it's possible that you can find how others have worked around this issue
                on the Community Program page.
app.problem_reporter.title: Something not working correctly?

app.program_collection.nothing: Sorry, no programs match your filters.

app.protected_route.inappropriate_messag: If you see inappropriate behavior or feel you are being harassed, please stop using Rovercode and tell your teacher.
app.rover_connection.unsupported_platfor: This browser or device is not supported. Try using Google Chrome or Microsoft Edge on a PC, Macbook, or Android tablet. Also, make sure Bluetooth is enabled.
